description: From Latin reluctāns, present participle of reluctor (“to struggle against, oppose, resist”), from re- (“back”) + luctor (“to struggle”).

adjectives.description: reluctant (comparative more reluctant, superlative most reluctant)

entries.meaning: Not wanting to take some action; unwilling.
examples: She was reluctant to lend him the money
Surprisingly, our new dog is a reluctant ball-retriever.

entries.meaning: (regular expressions) Tending to match as little text as possible.
